extracting common information from meta-analysis model output

Charles T. Gray and Malcolm Barrett

2019-04-10

Source: vignettes/extractMeta_WKH.Rmd
extractMeta_WKH.Rmd
library(metaverse)
#library(magrittr)
#library(metafor)
#library(broom)
#library(mbmisc)
#library(tidyverse)

Model objects can be challenging to work with in their raw form in R. The broom:: package provides tools to extract commonly desired model output in table form:

  1. tidy() summarizes information about model components
  2. glance() reports information about the entire model
  3. augment() adds information about observations to a dataset ()

demonstration

We begin by creating a random-effects model object via metafor::, which is included in the metaverse::.

# grab a dataset from metafor
# from the metafor homepage
dat.bcg <- metafor::dat.bcg
ma_model <-
  escalc(
    measure = "RR",
    ai = tpos,
    bi = tneg,
    ci = cpos,
    di = cneg,
    data = dat.bcg
  ) %>% rma(yi, vi, data = ., method = "EB")

broom functionality

  1. tidy() summarizes information about model components
ma_model %>% broom::tidy()
#> # A tibble: 14 x 6
#>    study   type    estimate std.error statistic    p.value
#>    <chr>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1 1       study    -0.889     0.571    -1.56   NA        
#>  2 2       study    -1.59      0.441    -3.59   NA        
#>  3 3       study    -1.35      0.644    -2.09   NA        
#>  4 4       study    -1.44      0.141   -10.2    NA        
#>  5 5       study    -0.218     0.226    -0.961  NA        
#>  6 6       study    -0.786     0.0831   -9.46   NA        
#>  7 7       study    -1.62      0.472    -3.43   NA        
#>  8 8       study     0.0120    0.0629    0.190  NA        
#>  9 9       study    -0.469     0.238    -1.98   NA        
#> 10 10      study    -1.37      0.270    -5.07   NA        
#> 11 11      study    -0.339     0.111    -3.05   NA        
#> 12 12      study     0.446     0.730     0.611  NA        
#> 13 13      study    -0.0173    0.267    -0.0648 NA        
#> 14 overall summary  -0.715     0.181    -3.95    0.0000774
  1. glance() reports information about the entire model
ma_model %>% broom::glance()
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>    nobs measure method i.squared h.squared tau.squared tau.squared.se
#>   <int> <chr>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1    13 RR      EB          92.3      13.0       0.318          0.174
#> # … with 4 more variables: cochran.qe <dbl>, p.value.cochran.qe <dbl>,
#> #   cochran.qm <dbl>, p.value.cochran.qm <dbl>
  1. augment() adds information about observations to a dataset ()
ma_model %>% broom::augment()
#> # A tibble: 13 x 6
#>    .observed  .fitted .se.fit .conf.low .conf.high  .resid
#>        <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1   -0.889  -0.801    0.411     -1.61     0.00524 -0.174 
#>  2   -1.59   -1.26     0.354     -1.95    -0.561   -0.870 
#>  3   -1.35   -0.990    0.437     -1.85    -0.134   -0.633 
#>  4   -1.44   -1.40     0.138     -1.67    -1.13    -0.727 
#>  5   -0.218  -0.287    0.212     -0.701    0.128    0.497 
#>  6   -0.786  -0.785    0.0823    -0.946   -0.623   -0.0711
#>  7   -1.62   -1.25     0.370     -1.97    -0.523   -0.906 
#>  8    0.0120  0.00301  0.0626    -0.120    0.126    0.727 
#>  9   -0.469  -0.506    0.221     -0.939   -0.0740   0.246 
#> 10   -1.37   -1.25     0.246     -1.73    -0.767   -0.656 
#> 11   -0.339  -0.353    0.110     -0.568   -0.139    0.376 
#> 12    0.446  -0.281    0.460     -1.18     0.621    1.16  
#> 13   -0.0173 -0.145    0.244     -0.623    0.333    0.698

requesting more features

Currently, this is restricted to metafor::rma model objects, but Malcolm and Charles are most happy to collaborate on expanding the functionality to other meta-analytic objects.

The easiest way to let us know is to log an issue on the metaverse:: GitHub repository.
